summary: This document is an invoice from AT&T Wireless addressed to Martin Golick, detailing charges for the billing cycle from September 15, 2004, to October 14, 2004. It includes a summary of monthly charges, payments received, and various service details. This document contains detailed records of phone call activities associated with the account of Martin Golick, including dates, times, call durations, and locations. It appears to be part of a larger investigation into communications related to the Epstein case. This document contains detailed records of voice usage for an account associated with Martin Golick, including incoming and outgoing calls, their durations, and associated charges. The records primarily focus on calls made to and from locations in Florida, particularly Palm Beach. This document contains detailed records of voice usage for an account belonging to Martin Golick, including call times, durations, and locations. It highlights numerous incoming and outgoing calls primarily from Palm Beach, Florida, with various mentions of additional charges for minutes used. This document contains detailed records of voice usage and multimedia messages associated with an account belonging to Martin Golick. It includes timestamps, charges, and descriptions of the messages sent and received, primarily from locations in Florida.

persons.name: Martin Golick
persons.context: Martin Golick is the account holder for the AT&T Wireless account referenced in the document, which details his billing information and charges.

keyFacts: The invoice is dated October 15, 2004, and covers the billing cycle from September 15, 2004, to October 14, 2004.
The total amount due on the invoice is $349.54.
Martin Golick's account shows a previous balance of $460.40 and payments received totaling $323.87.
The document includes various service charges, including monthly service and usage charges.
There are multiple mentions of calls made to and from Palm Beach, FL, indicating frequent communication in that area.
